intro: Lemapteris, commonly known as the feather fern, is a genus of ferns belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are often divided into numerous small, hair-like segments. These plants typically thrive in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Lemapteris species are found in various parts of the world, particularly in tropical and subtropical regions. Their unique morphology and ecological adaptability make them an interesting subject for botanical study.
